intro: Oryza subulata, commonly known as the needlegrass rice, is a grass species native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves and small, spikelet-bearing inflorescences. This plant typically grows in wetland or aquatic environments, preferring shallow water conditions. Its botanical structure includes hollow stems and narrow, linear leaves with a pointed tip. Oryza subulata is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
